Basic details: Edward Green, a 69-year-old male, presents to the clinic with complaints of left arm pain.
Vitals:
BP: 150/90 mm Hg
Temp: 98.4°F (36.9°C)
RR: 18/minute
HR: 88/minute, regular
Physical presentation:
Sit in a chair holding your left arm with your right hand, showing discomfort.
Occasionally rub your left shoulder and wince slightly.
If asked to move your arm, do so slowly and with visible discomfort.
If X-ray is mentioned by the examinee, ask, “What will an X-ray show?”
Challenging question: “Could this be something serious like a heart problem or just a muscle strain?”
